clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Turpentine has been used experimentally in a bath for the treatment of disseminated sclerosis and sexual dysfunction It also has been studied for its antibacterial activity and inhibition of osteoclast activity Turpentine is utilized in experimental models of inflammation to induce a systemic inflammatory immune response in animals

contraindications.disease: Human TCLo Inhalation 175ppm Effects lung Thorax or Respiration Human TCLo inhalation 6gm m3 3h Effects Behavioral Headache Infant LDLo Oral 1748 mg kg Effect GI Nausea or vomiting Man LDLo Oral 3mg kg Mouse LC50 inhalation 29mg m3 2h Mouse LD50 intravenous 1180ug kg Rabbit LDLo Skin 5010mg kg Effect general depressed activity
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Turpentine oil when inhaled may help reduce congestion When used on the skin turpentine oil may cause warmth and redness that can help relieve pain in the tissue underneath
